intro: Elatostema nanchuanense var. brachyceras, commonly known as the short-stemmed elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to China, specifically the Nanchuan region, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
